message.content: Hi there! It's great to connect with you. How can I help you today? Whether you have a question, need information, or just want to chat, I'm here to assist. Feel free to let me know what's on your mind!

## Testing various formats

*This should work*, as should **this**.

> Quotes should work, including with [links](https://example.com)

```
def code_block():
    """
    This is a docstring
    """
    text = "textstring with 'single quotes'"
    alt_text = 'textstring with "double quotes"'
    raw_text = r'escapable characters include: \, \n, \" \' '
    f_text = f"including {text}\n\n{alt_text} and\n\n{raw_text}\nnote the \\n characters!"
```

I'm testing stuff. Can you produce some arbitrarily complex markdown text to help me test things?

# Markdown Showcase

You're doing a great job testing markdown! Here's a comprehensive example with various markdown elements:

## Text Formatting

*Italics* and **bold** are working well. You can also do ***bold italics*** or ~~strikethrough~~ text.

Sometimes you need ^superscript^ or ~
I think you got cut off? Did you just generate your own stop character by mistake or something?

You're right, I did get cut off! I apologize for that error. Let me provide a complete markdown showcase without any accidental truncation:

# Markdown Showcase

## Text Formatting

*Italics* and **bold** are working well. You can also do ***bold italics*** or ~~strikethrough~~ text.

Sometimes you need <sup>superscript</sup> or <sub>subscript</sub> elements (note that these use HTML tags).

## Lists

### Ordered Lists
1. First item
2. Second item
   1. Nested item
   2. Another nested item
3. Third item

### Unordered Lists
- Bullet point
- Another point
  * Nested point with different marker
  * Another nested point
- Back to the main level

## Code Examples

Inline code: `const greeting = "Hello, world!";`

```javascript
// A more complex code block
function calculateFactorial(n) {
  if (n <= 1) return 1;
  return n * calculateFactorial(n - 1);
}

// Example usage
console.log(`5! = ${calculateFactorial(5)}`); // Outputs: 5! = 120
```

## Blockquotes

> This is a simple blockquote
> 
> > This is a nested blockquote with **formatted text**
> >
> > It

# Markdown Showcase

I'd be happy to create a complex markdown example for your testing! Here's a variety of markdown elements combined into one comprehensive sample:

## 1. Text Formatting

*Italic text* and _alternate italic_
**Bold text** and __alternate bold__
***Bold and italic*** or ___another way___
~~Strikethrough~~ for deleted content
`inline code` for technical terms

## 2. Lists

### Ordered List
1. First item
2. Second item
   1. Nested item 2.1
   2. Nested item 2.2
3. Third item with `code`

### Unordered List
- Main bullet
  * Sub-bullet with *italic*
  * Another sub-bullet
- Second bullet with **bold**
  - Even deeper nesting
    - And deeper still

## 3. Blockquotes

> This is a simple blockquote
> 
> > This is a nested blockquote with **formatting**
> >
> > ```python
> > # Even code inside blockquotes
> > def nested_function():
> >     return "Amazing!"
> > ```

## 4. Code Blocks

```javascript
// JavaScript example
function complexExample() {
  const obj = {
    name: "Test Object",
    values: [1, 2, 3],
    meta {
      created: "2023-11-14",
      tags: ["test", "example", "markdown"]
    }
  };
  
  console.log(`Created by ${obj.name} on ${obj.metadata.created}`);
  return obj.values.map(x => x * 2);
}
```

## 5. Tables

| Feature | Support | Complexity |
|---------|:-------:|----------:|
| Basic text | ✅ | Low |
| *Formatted* text | ✅ | Medium |
| [Links](#links) | ✅ | Medium |
| Alignment | ✅ | High |
| Nested `code` | ✅ | High |

## 6. Links and Images

[External link to Example](https://example.com)
[Reference link][ref-style]
[Link with title](https://example.com "Example Website")

![Alt text for an image](https://via.placeholder.com/150 "Image title")

[ref-style]: https://example.com/reference

## 7. Task Lists

- [x] Completed task
- [ ] Incomplete task
- [x] Task with **formatted** text and [link](https://example.com)

## 8. Horizontal Rules

Above the line

---

Below the line

***

Another style

## 9. Footnotes

Here's a sentence with a footnote reference[^1].

[^1]: This is the footnote content with *formatting* and [links](https://example.com).

## 10. Complex Nesting Example

> ### Heading inside a blockquote
> 
> - List inside blockquote
>   1. Numbered inside unordered
>      ```python
>      # Code block inside list inside blockquote
>      def inception():
>          return "Deep nesting"
>      ```
> 
> | Table | Inside |
> |-------|--------|
> | A blockquote | *Indeed* |

## 11. Definition Lists

Term 1
: Definition with *formatting* and `code`
: Multiple definitions possible

Term 2
: Another definition with **bold text**

## 12. Escaping Characters

\*Not italic\* and \`not code\`
Escaped backslash: \\
Escaped formatting: \**\_\~\`

Hope this helps with your testing! Let me know if you need any other specific markdown elements.
Can you do some code blocks containing complex HTML, including script tags and doctypes? And some markdown mixed with HTML? I'm basically testing a markdown renderer.
